issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

A 1.3.0 iPhone application does not run on the iPad in compatibility mode - the compatibility mode frame shows up, but the app does not load inside it. This can be recreated by creating a new iPhone project and attempting to run the project using the 3.2 SDK. Confirmed by me and a number of other community members.

Titanium Mobile 1.2.1 iPhone projects do not have this issue - they run in compatibility mode on the iPad as you would expect.

{html}
fields.summary: Titanium 1.3.0 iPhone apps do not run on iPad in compatibility mode

this was a problem i believe in copying the correct xib. we're now nibless and head (1.4)
